content:
I suggest you read the support article on profile per install before you even contemplate try to get the Beta to use the existing profile. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/dedicated-profile-thunderbird-installation

The fundamental problem being there is no going back to the release version from Beta for that profile.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
My "guess" is you are running into a particularly strict spam filter on the persons account. It could be a strict as to not deliver to the inbox unless your address is in the recipients address book.

There are many degrees between everything gets through to only those in the address book get through. Historically the most common stumbling block are email signatures, especially if you can send in web mail and get it delivered but not in Thunderbird. The issues with signatures are usually related to images for social media web sites as they have previously been used by spammers. But just the existence of a signature can be enough.

Then we have folks that are sending using their ISP server and an email address for another domain. This is a key indicator of SPAM. For instance sending for George@gmail.com using a outgoing mail server for Comcast, instead of the Gmail one.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Have you checked in the web interface at gmail that the problem gmail account has Thunderbird as an authorized app?
creator: MattAuSupport

content: You probably need to authorize Thunderbird to access the relevant item at gmail to complete the authorization process. It might be calendar, contacts or mail as each item is authorized separately by Google..
